cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 405 miles ESE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the north-western Gulf of Mexico toward the central Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast (between Port Mansfield and High Island, near Port O’Connor)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Mansfield to High Island, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield to High Island with some effects extending into the western Louisiana coastline
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Yes – forecast totals 3-5 inches with isolated 8 inches possible along Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Low probability (<5%) of tropical-storm-force winds reaching the port
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at the inland Port of Greater Baton Rouge
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain could produce 3-5 inches and localized flash flooding over the weekend
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased swells and dangerous rip currents along Louisiana Gulf approaches; possible river level rises on the lower Mississippi from runoff.
